terms.name: Belief
terms.definition: A truth claim about the world which one believes to be true.

terms.name: Facts
terms.definition: A truth claim which accurately describes sense perception, both in the content and the literal relationship between thoughts and the 5 main senses.

terms.name: Knowledge
terms.definition: Memory (which makes "self-knowledge" "self-memory", which is an oxymoron).

terms.name: Self Image
terms.definition: What one believes oneself to be, which are inherently emotional due to the nature of self-belief.

terms.name: Sensory Perception
terms.definition: Conscious experience occurring now.

terms.name: Past
terms.definition: Events which happened previously, but only are subjectively experienced as a thought now (never truly experienced).

terms.name: Future
terms.definition: Events which are expected to happen, but are only subjectively experienced as a thought now (never truly experienced).

terms.name: Reality
terms.definition: The existence of sensory perception (this is a panpsychist worldview, Jamie might say "physical reality").

terms.name: Emotions
terms.definition: Physical sensations in the body that are internally generated by evaluating sensory perception or thinking.

terms.name: Happiness
terms.definition: The default mode of experience where one has no negative beliefs about oneself that are currently operating.

terms.name: Anger
terms.definition: The belief that something has wronged you.

terms.name: Love
terms.definition: Present oneness of experience which facilitates naturally caring and altruistic behavior.

terms.name: Good
terms.definition: Evaluating one scenario to be favorable to another (which necessarily stems from not recognizing the oneness of experience, so there is nothing to compare in the first place).

terms.name: Bad
terms.definition: Evaluating one scenario to be less favorable to another (which necessarily stems from not recognizing the oneness of experience, so there is nothing to compare in the first place).

terms.name: Like
terms.definition: Good in terms of a sensory experience.

terms.name: Dislike
terms.definition: Bad in terms of a sensory experience.

terms.name: Observation
terms.definition: The fact of content appearing in awareness.

terms.name: Interpretation
terms.definition: A narrative created by thinking to describe a past event. An incorrect use of interpretation is what leads to the self-image which is often described as "experiencing things twice" (once as the event, another time as the interpretation).

terms.name: Guilt
terms.definition: The belief that one has caused unnecessary suffering, which encourages the mind to learn to not cause unnecessary suffering (not necessarily tied to self-image).

terms.name: Shame
terms.definition: The belief that one is insufficient (tied to self-image).

terms.name: Annoyance
terms.definition: The belief that one's current experience could extremely conceivably be better if some process was more efficient (necessarily tied to self-image since it stems from a failure to recognize the oneness of experience).

terms.name: Frustration
terms.definition: The belief that efforts are not leading to the intended results (not necessarily tied to self-image).

terms.name: Physical Time / Calendar Time
terms.definition: The sequential passage of events that is not directly experienced.

terms.name: Intelligence
terms.definition: The ability to recognize and correct errors in thinking.
